title: How to Make Mango Desserts

steps.headline: Chop the mangoes into small wedges.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Make or buy vanilla ice cream.
Smash the mangoes to a pulp.
Put them in the blender.
Add a few scoops of ice cream.
Pour in a cup of milk.
Blend until soft, but still a solid.
Scoop into cups (if you want it to be super fancy put it in martini glasses and garnish with mint).
Juice the mangoes.
Pour the juice into an ice tray with a Popsicle stick in each little hole full of juice.
Freeze for two days.
Enjoy your delicious Popsicle.
Put the coconut milk and pineapple juice into a bowl.
Add scoops of ice cream into the bowl and roll them around in the nice liquid.
Put the now coconut pineapple ice cream into a small fancy bowl, scoops should be round.
Cut mangoes into wedges and delicately add them on the side.
Add a chocolate wafer to the delicate little piece.
Put a few wedges of mango in a cup with a little bit of crushed ice.
Then put more ice and another few mango wedges.
Continue until the cup is 2/3 full.
Add some coffee.
Garnish with mint.

text: Mango Ice Cream Milkshake Chop the mangoes into small wedges.  Sprinkle with sugar.  Make or buy vanilla ice cream.  Smash the mangoes to a pulp.  Put them in the blender.  Add a few scoops of ice cream.  Pour in a cup of milk.  Blend until soft, but still a solid.  Scoop into cups (if you want it to be super fancy put it in martini glasses and garnish with mint).  Mango Popsicles Juice the mangoes.  Pour the juice into an ice tray with a Popsicle stick in each little hole full of juice.  Freeze for two days.  Enjoy your delicious Popsicle.  Tropical mango paradise Put the coconut milk and pineapple juice into a bowl.  Add scoops of ice cream into the bowl and roll them around in the nice liquid.  Put the now coconut pineapple ice cream into a small fancy bowl, scoops should be round.  Cut mangoes into wedges and delicately add them on the side.  Add a chocolate wafer to the delicate little piece.  Iced Mango Heaven Put a few wedges of mango in a cup with a little bit of crushed ice.  Then put more ice and another few mango wedges.  Continue until the cup is 2/3 full.  Add some coffee.  Garnish with mint.
